private_information: I arrive at Fisherman's Wharf at 09:00AM
I want to meet as many friends as possible today
I can travel between locations and must respect travel durations
traveler.goal: Maximize the number of friends met today while ensuring a meeting with Stephanie of at least 120 minutes.

private_information: I will be at Nob Hill from 04:45PM to 09:45PM
I can meet for at least 120 minutes during my available window
stephanie.goal: Meet the traveler for at least 120 minutes at Nob Hill between 04:45PM and 09:45PM.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent availabilities and travel times to produce a PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownwards solver that maximizes friends met while satisfying the constraints including the mandatory meeting with Stephanie.

public_information: Travel times in minutes: Fisherman's Wharf to Nob Hill is 11 and Nob Hill to Fisherman's Wharf is 11
You arrive at Fisherman's Wharf at 09:00AM
Stephanie is at Nob Hill from 04:45PM to 09:45PM
The traveler desires to meet Stephanie for a minimum of 120 minutes
Objective is to maximize number of friends met while respecting travel times and availability windows

availability.system_prompt: You are the traveler agent. Provide your available times, known arrival information, movement constraints, and any preferences in a concise machine-readable format. Do not produce PDDL. Produce only the information needed for scheduling in a structured textual form.
availability.prompt: You are the traveler. Use the public information and your private information to provide your availability, start location and any scheduling preferences. The orchestrator will use this to build a planning problem. Provide times and locations and indicate any hard constraints.

availability.system_prompt: You are the Stephanie agent. Provide your availability window, minimum meeting duration requirement, preferred meeting location, and any constraints in a concise machine-readable format. Do not produce PDDL. Produce only the information needed for scheduling in a structured textual form.
availability.prompt: You are Stephanie. Use the public information and your private information to declare your availability window at Nob Hill and the minimum required meeting duration. Provide times and any other constraints. The orchestrator will use this to build a planning problem.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems. You must produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep agent actions distinct and preserve scheduling and duration constraints. The result must be directly solvable by FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the availability reports from the traveler and Stephanie and the public travel time information. Build a temporal or time-encoded PDDL domain and problem that maximizes the number of friends met while ensuring the traveler meets Stephanie for at least 120 minutes at Nob Hill between 04:45PM and 09:45PM. The traveler starts at Fisherman's Wharf at 09:00AM and travel between Fisherman's Wharf and Nob Hill takes 11 minutes each way. Keep actions of agents distinct and include time modeling sufficient for FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
